column5: YOU WILL FIND in the DIARIES a LOT of POLITICS AND EVEN MORE CATS     THE PERSON who MAKES the FIRST COMMENT WILL GET TWO CATS EVERY PERSON WHO COMMENTS WILL GET A CAT     RULES IN THE DIARY WHEN YOU FIND SOMETHING in the DIARY that you LIKE YOU CAN REPOST IT AS COMMENT in the DIARY  PRESIDENT JOE BIDEN Biden and Harris will hold separate events Thursday to focus attention on Democratic efforts to protect voting rights.Harris will announce the expansion of the DNC's "I Will Vote" campaign. Biden will meet privately with a range of civil rights groups. https://t.co/OvQ7puPMXC  REPUBLICAN ADAM KINZINGER Republican Adam Kinzinger: "I think the vast majority if not all of them—my colleagues believe that this was a Trump-incited insurrection. But when you're in a tribe if you say something truthful that gets you kicked out of the tribe."https://t.co/POfcPmOC4R  FORMER CHIEF OF STAFF TO JOHN MCCAIN Former chief of staff to John McCain on how McCain felt about the insults Trump leveled at him:"It did not bother him a bit because he had such little respect — he had no respect for Donald Trump anyway."https://t.co/HkeknMdqaP  MTG Three weeks after she visited the Holocaust Museum and said she'd finally learned at age 47 that there's "nothing comparable" to the genocide of 6 million Jewish people Marjorie Taylor Greene invoked Nazi Germany to complain about COVID vaccine policies. https://t.co/qusixoEHmG  TEXAS Former Marine Derrik Gay is launching a challenge to Republican Beth Van Duyne the first Democrat to declare his bid for the Texas 24th.Gay who spent 13 years in the Marine Corps as an intel officer said the Jan. 6 attack was a "call to action." https://t.co/zBbniSnatz  WEST VIRGINIA Republican Gov. Jim Justice issued a stark warning to West Virginians: "If you're not vaccinated you're part of the problem." https://t.co/Vx7lVtYkeK  MONTANA Montana Republicans have passed voter restrictions that could have stark effects for Native American reservations.In 2018 Democratic Sen. Jon Tester won 7 of 8 Montana counties containing the headquarters of a federally recognized tribe.https://t.co/Zc7TJCIxXJ  ARIZONA Officials in Tucson plan to ignore a new Republican-backed 'Second Amendment sanctuary' law signed earlier this year that bars the use of any state or local resources to enforce federal gun laws that conflict with state law. https://t.co/tVpepV9NHO  TRUMP On a visit to Europe to mark the 100th anniversary of the end of World War I Donald Trump insisted to his then-chief of staff John Kelly: "Well Hitler did a lot of good things" according to the new book by WSJ's Michael Bender. https://t.co/mdxD9U9SRz  A friend and golfing partner of Trump — who gained notoriety for using that friendship to lobby Trump's admin — was charged with indecent assault last week in Pennsylvania on allegations he groped one of his dental patients according to court documents. https://t.co/jrLPCs5Anx  Assuming the lawsuit advances (which is a big if) Trump will have to give sworn testimony about January 6 https://t.co/olegHBbqQN  Trump is suing Mark Zuckerberg and Jack Dorsey https://t.co/NqOzSDJleV
